Authors:
Alfredo Justo, Eliseo Maria Battistin, Claudio
Angelini
Title:
Two new species of Pluteus section Celluloderma from the
Dominican Republic
Abstract:
Two new species of Pluteus sect. Celluloderma collected in
the Dominican Republic are described based on morphological and
molecular (nrITS) characters. P. crenulatus is characterized by the
sulcate and crenulate margin of the pileus and microscopically by the
absence of pleurocystidia and the clavate cheilo- and caulocystidia. P.
stenotrichus is characterized by the presence of very narrow and
internally septate cells in the pileipellis.
